title: How to Set Up Voicemail

steps.headline: Activate your phone.
steps.description: Charge it completely, if it is a new model.

steps.headline: Make sure you set up your voicemail within 60 days of plan activation.
steps.description: If you do not, the mailbox will be removed from your account.

steps.headline: Press down the number 1 on your mobile phone.
steps.description: Hold it until you hear a voicemail menu.

steps.headline: Choose a 4 to 15-digit number to serve as your password.
Record your personal voicemail greeting with the next prompt.
steps.description: Press the hash key when you have completed your recording.

steps.headline: Press the star key at any time to return to your voicemail menu and access other options.
Press and hold the number 1 from your phone to access voicemail.
steps.description: Type in your password. Messages will play in order from oldest to most recent. You can access your voicemail from a landline by calling your mobile number, including the area code. Press the star button and your password when prompted.

steps.headline: Charge your phone completely after your account is set up.
Press *86 and then the send button on your phone’s keypad.
Press the hash key to proceed into the setup menu.
Wait for the prompts to set up a password, name and greeting.
Press *86 and send to access your voicemail in the future.
steps.description: If you want to access it from a landline, call your mobile phone number. Press the hash key when you hear your greeting. Enter your password and the hash key to gain access.

steps.headline: Charge your phone completed.
steps.description: Make a call to test that your account is activated.

steps.headline: Press down the number 1 on your phone.
Wait for a prompt.
steps.description: The first time you call your voicemail system, you will be prompted to create a passcode. It must be between 4 and 10 digits.

steps.headline: Record your name when prompted.
Record your greeting with the next prompt.
Decide if you would prefer to access your voicemail without a passcode from your mobile phone, or if you want to enter the passcode each time.
steps.description: The direct route is called One-Touch Message Access. However, choosing to enter your passcode with make your voicemail more secure.

steps.headline: Select the message prompt when you receive a new voicemail to be transferred to your voicemail.
steps.description: Press and hold the number 1 to go straight to your messages, if you have chosen One-Touch Message Access. Access your voicemail through a landline by dialing your mobile number. Press the asterisk/star key during your message. Then, type in your passcode. You will always need a passcode for this method.

steps.headline: Charge your device as soon as you receive it.
Activate your phone, if you have not already.
steps.description: Make a call and write a text to ensure all services have been enabled.

steps.headline: Press the numbers 123 on your phone.
steps.description: You can also hold down the number 1.

steps.headline: Wait for a menu.
steps.description: If you are asked to type your password for the first time, you should dial the last 4 digits of your mobile phone number.

steps.headline: Select the menu to pick a new password.
steps.description: It can be any number combination between 4 and 7 digits.

steps.headline: Wait to be prompted to record your name and greeting.
steps.description: If you do not hear the prompt, you can listen to the main menu and press the number associated with recording a new message.

steps.headline: Access your voicemail by typing 123 and Send/Call on your phone.
steps.description: Press the start button to listen to new voicemails. You can also access your mobile voicemail from a landline. Dial your mobile phone number and press the star key once the greeting begins. Enter your password to gain access.

text: Setting Up Voicemail with AT&T Activate your phone. Charge it completely, if it is a new model. Make sure you set up your voicemail within 60 days of plan activation. If you do not, the mailbox will be removed from your account. Press down the number 1 on your mobile phone. Hold it until you hear a voicemail menu. Choose a 4 to 15-digit number to serve as your password. Enter it when prompted. Record your personal voicemail greeting with the next prompt. Press the hash key when you have completed your recording. Press the star key at any time to return to your voicemail menu and access other options.  Press and hold the number 1 from your phone to access voicemail. Type in your password. Messages will play in order from oldest to most recent. You can access your voicemail from a landline by calling your mobile number, including the area code. Press the star button and your password when prompted. Setting Up Voicemail with Verizon Charge your phone completely after your account is set up.  Press *86 and then the send button on your phone’s keypad.  Press the hash key to proceed into the setup menu.  Wait for the prompts to set up a password, name and greeting.  Press *86 and send to access your voicemail in the future. If you want to access it from a landline, call your mobile phone number. Press the hash key when you hear your greeting. Enter your password and the hash key to gain access. Setting Up Voicemail with Sprint Charge your phone completed. Make a call to test that your account is activated. Press down the number 1 on your phone. Hold it for several seconds. Wait for a prompt. The first time you call your voicemail system, you will be prompted to create a passcode. It must be between 4 and 10 digits. Record your name when prompted.  Record your greeting with the next prompt.  Decide if you would prefer to access your voicemail without a passcode from your mobile phone, or if you want to enter the passcode each time. The direct route is called One-Touch Message Access. However, choosing to enter your passcode with make your voicemail more secure. Select the message prompt when you receive a new voicemail to be transferred to your voicemail. Press and hold the number 1 to go straight to your messages, if you have chosen One-Touch Message Access. Access your voicemail through a landline by dialing your mobile number. Press the asterisk/star key during your message. Then, type in your passcode. You will always need a passcode for this method. Setting Up Voicemail with T-Mobile Charge your device as soon as you receive it.  Activate your phone, if you have not already. Make a call and write a text to ensure all services have been enabled. Press the numbers 123 on your phone. You can also hold down the number 1. Wait for a menu. If you are asked to type your password for the first time, you should dial the last 4 digits of your mobile phone number. Select the menu to pick a new password. It can be any number combination between 4 and 7 digits. Wait to be prompted to record your name and greeting. If you do not hear the prompt, you can listen to the main menu and press the number associated with recording a new message. Access your voicemail by typing 123 and Send/Call on your phone. Press the start button to listen to new voicemails. You can also access your mobile voicemail from a landline. Dial your mobile phone number and press the star key once the greeting begins. Enter your password to gain access.
sentences: Setting Up Voicemail with AT&T Activate your phone.
Charge it completely, if it is a new model.
Make sure you set up your voicemail within 60 days of plan activation.
If you do not, the mailbox will be removed from your account.
Press down the number 1 on your mobile phone.
Hold it until you hear a voicemail menu.
Choose a 4 to 15-digit number to serve as your password.
Enter it when prompted.
Record your personal voicemail greeting with the next prompt.
Press the hash key when you have completed your recording.
Press the star key at any time to return to your voicemail menu and access other options.
Press and hold the number 1 from your phone to access voicemail.
Type in your password.
Messages will play in order from oldest to most recent.
You can access your voicemail from a landline by calling your mobile number, including the area code.
Press the star button and your password when prompted.
Setting Up Voicemail with Verizon Charge your phone completely after your account is set up.
Press *86 and then the send button on your phone’s keypad.
Press the hash key to proceed into the setup menu.
Wait for the prompts to set up a password, name and greeting.
Press *86 and send to access your voicemail in the future.
If you want to access it from a landline, call your mobile phone number.
Press the hash key when you hear your greeting.
Enter your password and the hash key to gain access.
Setting Up Voicemail with Sprint Charge your phone completed.
Make a call to test that your account is activated.
Press down the number 1 on your phone.
Hold it for several seconds.
Wait for a prompt.
The first time you call your voicemail system, you will be prompted to create a passcode.
It must be between 4 and 10 digits.
Record your name when prompted.
Record your greeting with the next prompt.
Decide if you would prefer to access your voicemail without a passcode from your mobile phone, or if you want to enter the passcode each time.
The direct route is called One-Touch Message Access.
However, choosing to enter your passcode with make your voicemail more secure.
Select the message prompt when you receive a new voicemail to be transferred to your voicemail.
Press and hold the number 1 to go straight to your messages, if you have chosen One-Touch Message Access.
Access your voicemail through a landline by dialing your mobile number.
Press the asterisk/star key during your message.
Then, type in your passcode.
You will always need a passcode for this method.
Setting Up Voicemail with T-Mobile Charge your device as soon as you receive it.
Activate your phone, if you have not already.
Make a call and write a text to ensure all services have been enabled.
Press the numbers 123 on your phone.
You can also hold down the number 1.
Wait for a menu.
If you are asked to type your password for the first time, you should dial the last 4 digits of your mobile phone number.
Select the menu to pick a new password.
It can be any number combination between 4 and 7 digits.
Wait to be prompted to record your name and greeting.
If you do not hear the prompt, you can listen to the main menu and press the number associated with recording a new message.
Access your voicemail by typing 123 and Send/Call on your phone.
Press the start button to listen to new voicemails.
You can also access your mobile voicemail from a landline.
Dial your mobile phone number and press the star key once the greeting begins.
Enter your password to gain access.
